kana: おろしうりぎょうしゃ
example: Goods from factories go to wholesalers, and wholesalers sell them to retailers.
These shops and stores are called retailers.
Trading companies buy goods from overseas and sell them to retailers.
The path from producers to consumers is called distribution.
In recent years, commerce became very efficient because of ICT.
Computers manage buying, transporting, storing, selling, and delivering goods very efficiently.
Efficient distribution makes goods cheaper and easier to buy.
Internet shopping directly connects producers and consumers.
Computers manage buying, transporting, storing, selling, and delivering goods.
Internet shopping makes goods cheaper because storing costs are lower.
This makes distribution costs lower, so goods become cheaper.
Computers manage buying, transporting, storing, selling, and delivering goods very efficiently.
